content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5906.3 - Procedures

State Regulations
(a) Requests for
declaratory rulings shall be made to the general counsel of the foundation upon
a form prescribed by the foundation which shall contain sufficient information
to identify with particularity the person, the property or the state of facts
and the rule or statute enforceable by the foundation, the applicability of
which is sought to be determined or shall identify with particularity the
action, with respect to which the declaratory ruling is sought. Such request
shall cite the statute, rule, or regulation relied upon, and set forth a
complete and precise statement of the state of facts, persons or property with
respect to which a ruling is sought, together with a full disclosure of the
petitioner's interest. (b) Such
request must be submitted in writing to the general counsel of the foundation
on a form prescribed by the foundation by certified mail, return receipt
requested, addressed to the New York State Science and Technology Foundation, 99 Washington Avenue, Suite 1730, Albany, New York 12210. The returned postal
service receipt shall constitute proof of service which shall be deemed
effective on the day the request is received. (c) Such request may be accompanied by a
memorandum in support setting forth the reasons for the request. (d) The general counsel to the foundation may
decline to issue a declaratory ruling or advise that such request is
incomplete, ambiguous, inappropriate, or unnecessary under the facts and
circumstances recited herein. (e) The issuance of a declaratory ruling shall be within the discretion of the
general counsel, and nothing contained in this section shall confer upon any
person the right to compel the foundation to issue a declaratory
ruling. (f) Requests pursuant to
this subdivision shall be granted or denied by the general counsel, within 30
days of the date on which such request is received in proper form by the
general counsel, provided that in the case of a request for a declaratory
ruling with respect to whether an action by the foundation should be taken
pursuant to a rule, as defined in section
5906.2
(a)(2), the
request shall be granted or denied by the general counsel within 60 days of
such date. (g) Form for request for
declaratory ruling. New York State Science and Technology Foundation
